fields.summary: Mobile Web: CLI mobile web production builds include *.js.uncompressed.js files in addition to minified versions

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

components.name: Alloy
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the Alloy here.

fields.description:
Compiling a production version of a "mobile" web application results in:

>Build > mobileweb > mobileweb (a complete duplicate folder of the 1st mobile web folder)
>Build > mobile > hundreds of  somefile.uncompressed.js files
fields.summary: Mobile Web Production contains unnecessary and duplicate files

comments.body: [~ragrawal] Well, in 3.3.0, we no longer keep the uncompressed files. They existed mostly for debugging purposes.
